properties.title: Adam River
properties.description: Put in at an FSR bridge over the Adam

properties.title: Adam River
properties.description: Take out at a big eddy on the right. Steep bushwhack up to an old logging spur. Scout the takeout before putting on.

properties.title: Alsek River
properties.description: Serpentine Creek is another put-in option if you have a 4x4 capable shuttle vehicle.

properties.title: Alsek River
properties.description: You can pull out here and hike or float (at high flows) to the air strip.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Bottom Mile
properties.description: The put-in is roughly 1.5km up from the bridge at the first place where the road comes close to the river.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Bottom Mile
properties.description: You can takeout at the powerhouse or downstream at the bridges.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Box Canyon
properties.description: Put-in at the bridge to run 50/50 or walk downstream on the trail on river left to seal launch into the canyon below.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Box Canyon
properties.description: Park in one of the pullouts near the obvious debris flow corner.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Mine Run
properties.description: If you get the hike right, you'll end up here, mid-way through one of the bigger rapids of the run. If you get it wrong, you will probably be on a cliff.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Mine Run
properties.description: Takeout above the dam on river right.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Play Run
properties.description: The road up here is very overgrown.

properties.title: Ashlu Creek - Play Run
properties.description: There used to be a clearly marked trail with flagging tape but this may now not be obvious... check before you paddle down or you risk paddling into the Mine run!

properties.title: Ashnola River
properties.description: The upper put-in.

properties.title: Ashnola River
properties.description: Great camping.

properties.title: Babine River
properties.description: Take out for shorter trip

properties.title: Beaver River (Kinbasket Canyon)
properties.description: A muddy and rutted road leads to the bridge that serves as a put in.

properties.title: Beaver River (Kinbasket Canyon)
properties.description: A big parking lot and a short but steep hike out.

properties.title: Bedwell River
properties.description: Bedwell River put in river left just above You Creek confluence. Small camp option amongst the spruce trees.

properties.title: Bedwell River
properties.description: Government wharf

properties.title: Big Creek - Lower
properties.description: Erickson bridge put in. Much of surrounding area is private land.

properties.title: Big Creek - Lower
properties.description: Alternate takeout if you want to run Farwell Canyon rapid

properties.title: Big Mouth Creek
properties.description: Theres a nice pullout and a short bc bushwack to the river

properties.title: Big Silver Creek - Middle
properties.description: The access above the put in waterfall.

properties.title: Big Silver Creek - Middle
properties.description: The takeout for "Middle Big Silver."

properties.title: Big Silver Creek - Upper
properties.description: The access above the put in waterfall.

properties.title: Big Silver Creek - Upper
properties.description: Stop somewhere along this flat section and bushwhack up to the road. The next canyon is supposedly not runnable.

properties.title: Birkenhead River - Lower
properties.class: III(+), IV if doing the first rapids
properties.description: There is some rough parking here, this gives you a small entry rapid above Harry Dick's

properties.title: Birkenhead River - Lower
properties.class: III(+), IV if doing the first rapids

properties.title: Birkenhead River - Upper
properties.class: IV-V at medium, V at medium-high and up.
properties.description: Put in at the bridge.

properties.title: Birkenhead River - Upper
properties.class: IV-V at medium, V at medium-high and up.
properties.description: Takeout river left.

properties.title: Blaeberry River - Split Creek to Thompson Falls
properties.description: Enter the river here. If you want it a silly seal launch down the bank, through the trees is the most exciting, least necessary part of the run.

properties.title: Blaeberry River - Split Creek to Thompson Falls
properties.description: Take out before the 2 ugly crack rapids that are often filled with wood

properties.title: Blaeberry River - Thompson Falls Section
properties.description: The easiest access to the canyons below Thompson falls is to put in on river left just above Thompson falls and ferry over to river right to portage the falls. You can put back in by climbing down to a ledge just below the falls and seal launching in.

properties.title: Blaeberry River - Thompson Falls Section
properties.description: The easiest takeout is river left just before the bridge at the IOB campground.

properties.title: Blanket Creek (Sutherland Falls)
properties.description: The easiest place to hike in if you're coming in when the park is closed.

properties.title: Bobbie Burns Creek into Spillimacheen River
properties.description: While I haven't used this put in yet, it does look like a promising alternative to avoid the bushwack. It would add considerable time to the trip with a lot more flatwater and a longer shuttle. A shuttle driver would be ideal for this put in (to drive back to the highway via river left on their way to the takeout), however it is possible to use the river right road to connect this put in with either takeout. The river right road between the 2 put ins is not in great shape and having maps of some sort is recommended to avoid getting lost (B.C. backroads mapbooks are great!).

properties.title: Bobbie Burns Creek into Spillimacheen River
properties.description: Park at a small pullout where the river is closest to the road. The best trail is slightly downstream of the pullout.

properties.title: Boston Bar Creek
properties.description: Gravel pull off southbound. Unfortunately, the river is on the other side of the highway, where there is not a great pull out.

properties.title: Boston Bar Creek
properties.description: Check flows visually here. This creek is very close to the pass, and flows are hit or miss.

properties.title: Bowser River
properties.class: II-III with one long IV+ rapid
properties.description: From the end of the public Granduc Road, walk down the old mine dumps to the lakeshore.

properties.title: Bowser River
properties.class: II-III with one long IV+ rapid
properties.description: Possible takeout on the Bowser River?

properties.title: Bridge River
properties.description: Put in on Yalakom River and paddle the last few drops

properties.title: Bridge River - Terzaghi Dam to Yalakom
properties.description: There is a large Rec site area here with plenty of parking.

properties.title: Bridge River - Terzaghi Dam to Yalakom
properties.description: You are most likely going to be continuing downstream here anyway but you can also park near the confluence.

properties.title: Bulkley Canyon
properties.description: At the boat launch immediately upstream of the Suskwa FSR bridge over the Bulkley RIver on river right .

properties.title: Bulkley Canyon
properties.description: Approximately 750m upstream of the Skeena Confluence at Anderson Flats Boat Launch near Hazelton.

properties.title: Callaghan Creek
properties.description: Trail brings you to here.

properties.title: Callaghan Creek
properties.description: Takeout at the campground by the gauge (river left). Please do not camp here without paying.

properties.title: Cameron River
properties.description: Put in at the bridge.

properties.title: Cameron River
properties.description: Park in this clearcut for the takeout. There's a trail down to the river.

properties.title: Capilano River
properties.description: Launch just below the weir at the hatchery.

properties.title: Capilano River
properties.description: You can park river right below the highway bridge at a trailhead.

properties.title: Cariboo River - Lower Run
properties.class: II to III (III+ at high water)

properties.title: Cariboo River - Lower Run
properties.class: II to III (III+ at high water)

properties.title: Cariboo River - Upper Run
properties.class: III+ to IV- (IV in high water)

properties.title: Cariboo River - Upper Run
properties.class: III+ to IV- (IV in high water)
properties.description: Take out at the bridge or if you don't like the look of the scramble find somewhere lower down.

properties.title: Cascade Creek
properties.description: You can see the trail along river right we followed.

properties.title: Cayoosh Creek
properties.description: Put in at this bridge.

properties.title: Cayoosh Creek
properties.description: Takeout at the bridge.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Balls To The Wall
properties.description: House Rock put in - also the take out for the Upper Cheak

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Balls To The Wall
properties.description: Take out near the Cal-Cheak camp site.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Cal-Cheak (Callaghan into Cheakamus)
properties.description: This put in has a few more waves including a reasonable one at the right water levels.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Cal-Cheak (Callaghan into Cheakamus)
properties.description: There is flagging tape, but if you don't know where this is, inspect it beforehand.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Cheakamus Lake Down
properties.description: Alternate put in at a bridge on the Helm Creek trail, avoids some wood.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Cheakamus Lake Down
properties.description: Take out behind two big rocks river left. Waterfall (V) just downstream.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Daisy Lake Canyon
properties.description: This put-in skips the class 3-4 Calcheak run.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Daisy Lake Canyon
properties.description: There is a trail in the forest that goes up to the highway.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Dam Run
properties.description: Park in the (very) small pullout immediately before the highway bridge and walk to the river from here.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Dam Run
properties.description: Exit the river here and take the short trail up to the parking lot.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Upper
properties.class: IV at 2.5, continuous.  Gets harder as levels rise.

properties.title: Cheakamus River - Upper
properties.class: IV at 2.5, continuous.  Gets harder as levels rise.
properties.description: Take out at the old river gauge

properties.title: Chehalis River - Lower (aka Statlu-Chehalis)
properties.description: An alternate put in on the Chehalis River, if Statlu Creek is too low or too difficult for your group. Steep trail down to the river.

properties.title: Chehalis River - Lower (aka Statlu-Chehalis)
properties.description: Gauge is located here upstream on river right.

properties.title: Chehalis River - Upper
properties.description: Informal campground on Chehalis Lake

properties.title: Chemainus River - Copper Canyon
properties.description: Put in here in Chemainus River Park.

properties.title: Chemainus River - Copper Canyon
properties.description: Take out river right here.

properties.title: Chilcotin River  (Chilko-Chilcotin-Fraser)
properties.description: Taseko River put in

properties.title: Chilcotin River  (Chilko-Chilcotin-Fraser)
properties.description: Typical Chilko-Chilcotin-Fraser takeout on the Fraser River

properties.title: Chilko - Bidwell to Taseko
properties.description: There's an old boat ramp here which makes easy access back up to the campground.

properties.title: Chilliwack Canyon - Camp Foley to Slesse
properties.class: III-IV low, IV- medium, IV high
properties.description: Put in at the bridge, either upstream/river left or downstream/river right

properties.title: Chilliwack Canyon - Camp Foley to Slesse
properties.class: III-IV low, IV- medium, IV high
properties.description: Watch for anglers and their hooks and lines

properties.title: Chilliwack River - Pointa Vista to Vedder Bridge
Chilliwack River - Pointa Vista to Vedder Bridge
Chilliwack River – Post Creek to Camp Foley
Chilliwack River – Post Creek to Camp Foley
Chilliwack River - Slesse to Tamihi
properties.description: Watch for anglers and their gear

properties.title: Chilliwack River - Tamihi to Pointa Vista
Chilliwack River - Tamihi to Pointa Vista
Clearwater River - Gatling Gorge
properties.description: You can't take-out here any more because the road is out, continue down the Sabretooth section.

properties.title: Clearwater River - Play Run
properties.description: Please do not block the ramp and do not drive down to the river if the gate is open.

properties.title: Clearwater River - Upper
properties.description: 45 minute walk to Moul Falls then some extra to get down to the river

properties.title: Clearwater River - Upper
properties.description: Take out before the entry rapid to The Kettle

properties.title: Clearwater River - Upper Upper
properties.description: There is parking + a toilet here, a short walk up from the river.

properties.title: Clendinning Creek
properties.description: Land the float plane here.

properties.title: Clore River - Grand Canyon
properties.description: Land the float plane here.

properties.title: Clore River - Grand Canyon
properties.description: Below Flintstone Canyon.

properties.title: Cowichan River - Skutz Falls to Marie Canyon
properties.description: Optional put in to run Skutz Falls (IV)

properties.title: Cowichan River - Skutz Falls to Marie Canyon
properties.description: Extends the run with some class II

properties.title: Dipper Creek
properties.description: An alternative put in. Very low volume until the Carnival Confluence. Not yet explored? Might not be good.

properties.title: Dipper Creek
properties.description: The end. Bash up to the Squamish logging road. Or, follow the animal trail back up to the Vertigo parking lot. Or continue down the Squamish canyons.

properties.title: Downie Canyon
properties.description: Use the bridge

properties.title: Downie Canyon
properties.description: Park just off the bridge

properties.title: Eagle River
properties.description: Float plane drop off

properties.title: East Boulder Creek
properties.description: Put in above the falls.

properties.title: East Boulder Creek
properties.description: Park here. River access is obvious.

properties.title: Elaho River - Fear Canyon
properties.description: The upper section is changing because of on-going blasting to improve fish passage. Scout accordingly.

properties.title: Elaho River - Fear Canyon
properties.description: There's a small pullout just downstream of the bridge near the gauge.

properties.title: Elaho River - Upper
properties.description: Easy put in.

properties.title: Elaho River - Upper
properties.description: If you head down past here the road is nowhere close to the river.

properties.title: Elk River - Middle
properties.description: This is the put-in if you don't run the falls.

properties.title: Elk River - Middle
properties.description: Take out here.

properties.title: Elk River - Upper
properties.description: Launch at the bridge above the dam.

properties.title: Foley Creek
properties.class: III(+) with potential IV moves with wood.
properties.description: There is possibility to put in a few rapids higher up on Foley Creek and run some slightly harder white-water.  This will depend on wood.

properties.title: Foley Creek
properties.class: III(+) with potential IV moves with wood.
properties.description: You could probably find a way to take-out and get to the FSR but let's face it, you're going to continue down and do the Chilliwack Canyon aren't you?

properties.title: Fraser River – Alexandra Bridge to Yale
properties.class: : Two III-IV drops (difficult to portage) and lots of flatwater.

properties.title: Fraser River – Alexandra Bridge to Yale
properties.class: : Two III-IV drops (difficult to portage) and lots of flatwater.

properties.title: Gamsby River
properties.description: Land the float plane here.

properties.title: Gilttoyees Creek
properties.description: Heli drop on a beach in this area.

properties.title: Gilttoyees Creek
properties.description: UTM coordinates are: Zone 09U; 5971320 m North; 0500850 m East

properties.title: Goldstream Falls
properties.description: Park under the hysdro lines and bushwack to the river

properties.title: Goldstream Falls
properties.description: Walk up the bridge drainage system back to the highway.

properties.title: Gordon River - Flood Run
properties.description: This is the fourth bridge (counting from the ocean) over the river.

properties.title: Gordon River - Flood Run
properties.description: This is also the put-in for the Upper Gordon.

properties.title: Gordon River - Middle Gordon
properties.description: If you don't want to use or can't find the other put in.

properties.title: Gordon River - Middle Gordon
properties.description: Take out at the Bugaboo Creek confluence. A notable waterfall is found at the confluence. There is a fixed rope to assit in climbing out of the canyon. We recommend just running out the lower Gordon to avoid the hike out, unless the river is low.

properties.title: Gordon River - Upper Gordon
properties.description: Put in at the third bridge (from the ocean) over the Gordon. There is a large boulder with a memorial bolted on it downstream of the bridge.

properties.title: Gordon River - Upper Gordon
properties.description: Take out 200 meters below the confluence with Loup Creek.

properties.title: Grand Canyon of the Stikine
properties.description: There may not be a more iconic in kayaking lore put-in than this.

properties.title: Grand Canyon of the Stikine
properties.description: Take out at the Tahltan confluence where the river is close to the road.

properties.title: Granite Creek
properties.description: The put in bridge is the first bridge above the take out.

properties.title: Granite Creek
properties.description: The river is signed Renfrew Creek at this bridge.

properties.title: Green River - Middle
properties.description: Put in at this bridge over the river, accessed by turning off at Wedge Woods.

properties.title: Green River - Middle
properties.description: Take out at the bridge.

properties.title: Gun Creek
properties.class: III-IV.  Slightly stressful because of wood, and a lack of good eddies.
properties.description: Jewel Creek parking lot for the South Chilcotin Mountain Park is the easiest put in. Options above and below here.

properties.title: Gun Creek
properties.class: III-IV.  Slightly stressful because of wood, and a lack of good eddies.
properties.description: Take out a the BC Hydro Gun Creek campsite.  It's a nice free campsite to sleep at too.

properties.title: Harris Creek - Canyon
properties.description: Driving upstream from the take out, start paddling when the river is close to the road.

properties.title: Harris Creek - Canyon
properties.description: Take out at the bridge. It is obvious.

properties.title: Heber River - Lower
properties.description: Put in where the river is closest to the road, down a steep bank.

properties.title: Heber River - Lower
properties.description: Takeout at the baseball diamond

properties.title: Hirsch Creek
properties.description: If you made it to the right spot, you'll be 50m upstream of the first rapid, "Wake Up Call."

properties.title: Hirsch Creek
properties.description: Take out at the bridge.

properties.title: Homathko River
properties.description: The put-in on Tatlayoko Lake.

properties.title: Hurley River - Canyon
properties.description: If the Cadwallader has enough water, this might be the best put in option.

properties.title: Hurley River - Canyon
properties.description: Take out at the bridge over the Bridge River, just below the confluence with the Hurley.

properties.title: Iskut River
properties.description: Easy bridge put on.

properties.title: Iskut River
properties.description: Hike up this river to the bridge.

properties.title: Iskut River - Kinaskan Lake down
properties.description: Kinaskan Lake Campground

properties.title: Iskut River - Kinaskan Lake down
properties.description: 1km trail back to highway.

properties.title: Jordan River
properties.description: Drive till you hit the washout and hop in.

properties.title: Jordan River
properties.description: Use the parking lot across the bridge. Be courteous to mountain bikers and gravel trucks.

properties.title: Khtada River
properties.description: Hike up river left and aim for here.

properties.title: Kicking Horse - Palliser to Kicking Horse Rest Area
properties.description: Putting in here places you just upstream of all the whitewater this section has to offer. Alternate put ins that skip some of the easier class 2-3 can be accessed by turning off the highway 1 exit further west, however the shuttle is the same length as the highway is divided.

properties.title: Kicking Horse - Palliser to Kicking Horse Rest Area
properties.description: Take out here to avoid running the "Middle-Middle" or "Unraftable" section

properties.title: Kicking Horse River - Lower Canyon to Downtown Golden
properties.description:
Do Not Block The Gate! 
Hike in to here from the highway. Drop kayaks and gear at the gated access road, drive vehicles up to park at the top of the hill in the huge gravel pullout, and walk down the CP access road and across the train tracks. 
This put in is on CP private property. Please exercise common sense and courtesy while using this put in. Do Not Block The Gate.

properties.title: Kicking Horse River - Lower Canyon to Downtown Golden
properties.description: This is the most commonly used takeout by locals, however the run ends in town so there are many options, including riverside bars and restaurants and even a micro-brewery. Put some of that fancy waterproof money in your life jacket and enjoy a drink while shuttle is run.

properties.title: Kicking Horse - Yoho Park Boundary to Palliser
properties.description: Commercial rafting put it, use with consideration and do not block access with vehicles.

properties.title: Kicking Horse - Yoho Park Boundary to Palliser
properties.description: A slightly convoluted logging road that exits highway 1 eastbound ends up at the river. There are also commercial rafting lunch spots and put ins along this logging road. Staying right at every turn lands you at the best recreational put in.

properties.title: Kitsumkalum (Kalum) River
properties.class: III+ to IV.  Pushy at high water - a swim would be unpleasant.
properties.description: Takeout. If you have high clearance, you can park at the river. Otherwise you'll have to walk.

properties.title: Klastline
properties.description: Fly into this lake from Dease Lake. Catch a float plane ride from B.C.-Yukon Air.

properties.title: Klastline
properties.description: Park the takeout vehicle out of the way here. Watch out for mice and be prepared for blackflies

properties.title: Kleanza Creek
properties.description: Hike for 1 km from wash out to bridge

properties.title: Kleanza Creek
properties.description: Take out at camp ground

properties.title: Kokish River
properties.description: Put in at the bridge over the river at the outlet of Ida Lake.

properties.title: Kokish River
properties.description: Take out at the main road over the river (the road that goes to Telegraph Cove.

properties.title: Lens Creek
properties.class: IV-V at low to medium flows
properties.description: Easy put in at this bridge.

properties.title: Lens Creek
properties.class: IV-V at low to medium flows
properties.description: Take out at this bridge. Access is easy.

properties.title: Lillooet River - Between the Lakes
properties.description: If you have a lot of vehicles, enjoy a 4km float across the lake to the river from here.

properties.title: Lower Pingston
properties.description: A scrambley trail down from the road on the south side of the bridge

properties.title: Lower Pingston
properties.description: Takeout, beach, and beautiful campsite. Also the place to drive to park and huck the lower falls

properties.title: Lynn Creek
properties.class: III at low levels, IV when the water is high.
properties.description: Park here and walk down to the bridge.

properties.title: Lynn Creek
properties.class: III at low levels, IV when the water is high.
properties.description: Takeout at Bridgeman Park.

properties.title: Mamquam River - Upper
properties.description: There's a small campsite on river left opposite skookum creek where it's easy to put on

properties.title: Mamquam River - Upper
properties.description: Take out BEFORE the dam site on river left. There is a warning sign and a rope across the river but if the dam is open there is NO EDDY at the sign.

properties.title: McGregor Canyon
properties.description: Easiest Access to the McGregor Canyon. Will involve a few kms of flatwater

properties.title: McGregor Canyon
properties.description: If the road goes all the way here this could work as the furthest uptream takeout. However, the road directly opposite was more alder and swamp than road anymore, so it is doubtful that this river left road would be in much better shape. (although it would be difficult for it to be in worse shape)

properties.title: Meager Creek - Lower
properties.description: Put in where the road drops back to river level.

properties.title: Meager Creek - Lower
properties.description: Take out at confluence of Perkins Creek and Lillooet River. Short bushwhack up to the road.

properties.title: Middle Memekay River
properties.description: Approximate location of easiest put in

properties.title: Moyeha River
properties.class: Scenic I-III packrafting, or manky IV-V creeking
properties.description: Widening or pond of Moyeha River, below which the river is channelized but steep.

properties.title: Moyeha River
properties.class: Scenic I-III packrafting, or manky IV-V creeking
properties.description: Possible water taxi pick up point. Discuss with boat captain ahead of time, there are no docks.

properties.title: Muelville Creek falls
properties.description: Park here and carry down the hiking trail to the falls

properties.title: Nahatlach River – Francis Lake to Apocynum Campground
Nahatlach River – Francis Lake to Apocynum Campground
Nahatlatch River - Canyon
properties.description: Apocynum Campground put-in.

properties.title: Nahatlatch River - Canyon
properties.description: Take out here.

properties.title: Nass River
properties.description: The source.  Land a plane or take the long way and drive + hike.

properties.title: Nass River
properties.description: Takeout at the bridge from the "Middle" Nass.

properties.title: Norrish Creek
properties.class: IV-IV+ at medium levels.  Mainly class III-IV but one unportagable rapid is tricky and dangerous.
properties.description: About 7km up the Norrish Creek FSR, look for an old road dropping towards the river.

properties.title: Norrish Creek
properties.class: IV-IV+ at medium levels.  Mainly class III-IV but one unportagable rapid is tricky and dangerous.
properties.description: The road to the takeout is gated, so park a few hundred meters west of the bridge. The gauge is found on the downstream river left side of the road bridge.

properties.title: North Stein River
properties.description: The easiest takeout is in Lytton at a public boat launch

properties.title: Pamela Creek
properties.description: Start at the convenient bridge over the Pamela.

properties.title: Pamela Creek
properties.description: Park in the clear cut - the river is just down through the forest.

properties.title: Perry River
properties.description: An obvious pull out. Follow the atv trail down until it becomes a creek that leads you to the river.

properties.title: Perry River
properties.description: Be mindful of the private landowners here. Don’t be the reason Koby Trinker gets mean emails from them. Be clean and quiet. No burnouts and no camping.

properties.title: Pingston - Middle
properties.class: IV with a short V section at the end
properties.description: Park on river left at the discontinued bridge

properties.title: Pingston - Middle
properties.class: IV with a short V section at the end
properties.description: Park on either side of the bridge, but the easiest access to the river is on river right

properties.title: Pitt River - Upper
properties.description: The Upper Pitt can also be reached via the Rubble Creek Trailhead and paddling across Garibaldi Lake.

properties.title: Prospect Creek
properties.description: Possible alternate put in. River below appears to be continuous class III+ full of wood with at least one waterfall.

properties.title: Puntledge River - Upper
properties.description: Put in on river left just below diversion dam.

properties.title: Puntledge River - Upper
properties.description: A commonly used takeout option for the Lower Puntledge

properties.title: Quesnel River
properties.class: III+ to IV- (IV at High water)

properties.title: Quesnel River
properties.class: III+ to IV- (IV at High water)

properties.title: Rogers Creek
properties.description: Bushwhack to the river from here.

properties.title: Rogers Creek
properties.description: Take out below the bridge to avoid the property owner upstream on river right.

properties.title: Rutherford Creek
properties.class: Continuous class IV-V, class V at higher levels.
properties.description: Rutherford Creek take out, at the Route 99 highway crossing. Look for the powerhouse, you can't miss it. Also the location of the Rutherford Creek artificial whitewater course.

properties.title: Ryan River - Upper
properties.description: Put in location - you can start lower than here if you get tired of hiking.

properties.title: Ryan River - Upper
properties.description: Approximate take out location and the site of the washed out bridge.

properties.title: Seymour River Canyon
properties.class: Highly level dependent - ranges from fun class IV to raging class V.
properties.description: There are stairs up to the road from here.

properties.title: Seymour River - Lower run
properties.description: Rocky bank just below rail road bridge

properties.title: Silverhope Creek
properties.class: IV-IV+ to V, depending on the put in and take out used.
properties.description: Gives access to the class V upper stretch of the river. There is a lot of wood immediately out of the lake, so you might want to scout the start to see if it's worth putting in here, or a little further down.

properties.title: Silverhope Creek
properties.class: IV-IV+ to V, depending on the put in and take out used.
properties.description: The bottom-most takeout for Silverhope.

properties.title: Similkameen Canyon
properties.description: A novelty waterfall coming out of a tunnel under the highway.

properties.title: Similkameen Canyon
properties.description:
Using this take-out makes the run a lot shorter, 1.5 hours and avoids running the harder last canyon and avoids a lot of flat water.

The last bit of the road to the campsite is steep and you need AWD/4WD to get down and definitely back up it!

You can park higher and walk down/up easily.

properties.title: Skagit River - Wilderness Section
properties.description: Put in on either Sumallo or Skagit Rivers

properties.title: Skagit River - Wilderness Section
properties.description: Take out for class II-III roadless section. Put in for class I section.

properties.title: Skookum Creek
properties.description: Hike to the river from here, fall-line, just downstream of a small stream.

properties.title: Skookum Creek
properties.description: Skookum Creek take out bridge, just above its confluence with the Mamquam.

properties.title: Slesse Creek
properties.class: III with a short IV- canyon

properties.title: Slesse Creek
properties.class: III with a short IV- canyon

properties.title: Small River
properties.description: Put in here for Class 4 (at the start) and class 3

properties.title: Small River
properties.description: park near the top of the rest area for the shortest walk from the river

properties.title: Snowcap Creek
properties.description: Put in at Glacier Lake.

properties.title: Snowcap Creek
properties.description: Take out at the bridge.

properties.title: Soo River
properties.class: IV at medium levels, somewhat continuous.  Tolerates high water very well, but becomes class V.
properties.description: Hike in from here

properties.title: Soo River
properties.class: IV at medium levels, somewhat continuous.  Tolerates high water very well, but becomes class V.
properties.description: The take out.

properties.title: Soo River - Railroad Canyon
properties.description: Trail leads to an easy put-in below the rail bridge.

properties.title: Spillimacheen
properties.description: Park at the campsite on the right side of the road. Cross the road and look for flagging tape that marks an old skid road (just downstream from the campsite). Follow the trail down to the river. This is not a long walk in, but the last part is quite steep.

properties.title: Squamish River - Upper
properties.class: III-IV boating through some significant canyons.
properties.description: A steep and loose draw gives access to the canyon.

properties.title: Squamish River - Upper
properties.class: III-IV boating through some significant canyons.
properties.description: The hook in the canyon here is obvious and the walk up to the road is reasonable. See the description for more info.

properties.title: Statlu Creek - Statlu Canyon
properties.description: Third bridge over Statlu, the put in. 5 km from the first bridge.

properties.title: Statlu Creek - Statlu Canyon
properties.description: There is usually a locked gate here where the road heads up the Statlu. Use the bridge piling as a visual gauge.

properties.title: Stawamus River
properties.description: Just below a small dam. The biggest rapids are not far below here.

properties.title: Stawamus River
properties.description: Take out anywhere along the dyke. The river braids and has a lot of logjams below the end of the dyke.

properties.title: Stein River - Multiday Trip
properties.description: The float plane option.

properties.title: Stein River - Multiday Trip
properties.description: Lytton Boat Launch.

properties.title: Stikine - Tahltan to Telegraph
properties.description: Gravel bar at confluence of Tahltan and Stikine Rivers

properties.title: Stikine - Tahltan to Telegraph
properties.description: Takeout at confluence of Telegraph Creek and Stikine River in town of Telegraph Creek

properties.title: St. Leon Creek
properties.description: Park here and hike down to the river.

properties.title: St. Leon Creek
properties.description: The take out is where highway 23 crosses St. Leon Creek.

properties.title: Tamihi Creek (Lower)
properties.description: There isn't a super obvious place to start, there was wood in the first manky rapid so we bush-whacked in below it.

properties.title: Tamihi Creek (Lower)
properties.description: Take out on river right below the bridge.

properties.title: Tamihi Creek - Upper
properties.description: Not sure if accurate yet

properties.title: Tamihi Creek - Upper
properties.description: Scout this first, there is a class V / VI rapid at the bridge you wouldn't want to run.

properties.title: Tatlow Creek
properties.description: Aim to put in directly across from the small creek that enters Tatlow on river right, above the start of the canyon.

properties.title: Tatlow Creek
properties.description: There is an old bridge at the take out.

properties.title: Thompson River
properties.description: Put in at this ravine. It's an obvious rafting put in. Be careful as the parking is along a busy, major highway.

properties.title: Thompson River
properties.description: Lower, public access boat ramp.

properties.title: Tingle Creek
properties.description: Beautiful sand bars beneath granite monoliths of The Defendant and Judge Howay.

properties.title: Tingle Creek
properties.description: A variety of exit options exist.  Boat pick up or flatwater lake paddling.

properties.title: Toby Creek - 7 Canyons
properties.class: Mostly class IV/IV+ with one definite class V that can be portaged
properties.description: The river runs next to the road for quite a distance with many alternate put ins. The higher you go the longer and mellower of a warm up you get.

properties.title: Toby Creek - 7 Canyons
properties.class: Mostly class IV/IV+ with one definite class V that can be portaged
properties.description: Park on River right before crossing the bridge on your way up to the put in.

properties.title: Trent River
properties.class: V for the waterfall; III for the paddle out

properties.title: Trent River
properties.class: V for the waterfall; III for the paddle out

properties.title: Trout Creek
properties.description: Put in at the back of the rodeo grounds

properties.title: Trout Creek
properties.description: Paddle out into the lake and turn right to get to the beach by the parking lot.

properties.title: Troutline Creek
properties.description: Put in for upper float

properties.title: Troutline Creek
properties.description: Take out for upper float. Put in for lower canyons.

properties.title: Tulameen River
properties.description: For  slightly shorter run.

properties.title: Tutshi River
properties.class: III-IV at low water, IV-V at high water
properties.description: Hike from the road into here.

properties.title: Tutshi River
properties.class: III-IV at low water, IV-V at high water
properties.description: Takeout shortly below Final Rinse.

properties.title: Ucona River - Upper
properties.description: Approximate location of parking for the take out. Scout takeout ahead of time.

properties.title: Upana River
properties.description: Multiple put in options along this roadside section

properties.title: Upper Callaghan
properties.class: III+ with one IV- easy waterfall
properties.description: Hike up the trail on river left until you see 2 benches.... look for the pink flagging tape and follow it down to a small put-on.   This allows you to run the funnest rapid above the bridge without needing to do the long walk into Madaley Creek.

properties.title: Upper Callaghan
properties.class: III+ with one IV- easy waterfall
properties.description: This take-out is the same as the put-on for the main Callaghan run.  There is a good path back to the road.

properties.title: Upper Pingston
properties.description: This is also the Middle Pingston put-in.

properties.title: Upper Soo
properties.class: III (with a major portage, and quite a bit of flat water)
properties.description: It is accessed via a long hike from Callaghan Lake.

properties.title: Upper Soo
properties.class: III (with a major portage, and quite a bit of flat water)
properties.description: This is the put-in to the Railway Canyon Section of the Soo!

properties.title: White River - Lower
properties.description: Put in just below a 5m riverwide ramp drop

properties.title: White River - Lower
properties.description: A commonly used takeout at a private campground

properties.title: White River (Nass tributary)
properties.description: bushwhack to Highway 37

properties.title: White River - Upper
properties.description: Potential take out up a steep trail. More likely to just continue down the Lower White (III).

properties.title: Williams Creek
properties.description: Approximate Race Course section put in.

properties.title: Williams Creek
properties.description: The gauge is painted on the river left side of the road bridge

properties.title: Wilson/Fitzstubbs Creek
properties.description: After a long drive around the canyon the road comes back closer to the river. Look for an slightly hidden overgrown atv trail on the left. Park here and follow the trail 500m to the river.

properties.title: Wilson/Fitzstubbs Creek
properties.description: A lovely alternate takeout to end your day in the warm waters of slocan lake.

properties.title: Yoho
properties.description: Small pull-out about 100m downstream of the gauge
